description: Applications for a new, renewed, replacement, updated or extended passport.
title: Passport applications
costs: This is the unit cost for producing and issuing a passport. Although this is a cost-recovery funded service, the average cost does not align with individual passport fees as it's an aggregation of the differing volumes and channel pricing structures for the various passport types produced by HM Passport Office.
other-notes: This includes all passport types: jumbo, standard, adult, child, first time, renewals, replacement, fast track and premium.

modules.title: Total cost
info: This is the unit cost for producing and issuing a passport. Although this is a cost-recovery funded service, the average cost does not align with individual passport fees as it's an aggregation of the differing volumes and channel pricing structures for the various passport types produced by HM Passport Office.

Total cost is the overall cost per year of providing a service, including staff, IT and accommodation costs; the total cost is automatically calculated from volume and cost per transaction figures, and some rounding errors may occur.

modules.title: Cost per transaction
info: This is the unit cost for producing and issuing a passport. Although this is a cost-recovery funded service, the average cost does not align with individual passport fees as it's an aggregation of the differing volumes and channel pricing structures for the various passport types produced by HM Passport Office.
Cost per transaction is the average cost of providing each successfully completed transaction, across all channels. Staff, IT and accommodation costs should be included.

modules.title: Transactions per quarter
modules.description: Total number of transactions each quarter

modules.title: Digital take-up
info: Digital take-up measures the percentage of completed applications that are made through a digital channel versus non-digital channels.
